definition: to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
surname Huai

sentences.english: I'm afraid sth have been primitively programmed.
sentences.chinese: 我们能做的恐怕只有释怀。

sentences.english: Seeing this is the first step. Letting go comes next.
sentences.chinese: 认识到这一点是第一步，学会释怀就是第二步。

sentences.english: One of the hardest things in coping with adultery is to actually forgive the marriage partner that has committed the adulterous act.
sentences.chinese: 真正为另一半的出轨释怀是极其艰难的。

sentences.english: I can't get over the fact that Alice was promoted, and I wasn't.
sentences.chinese: 爱莉丝获得升迁而我没有，这件事我就是无法释怀。

sentences.english: His stomach jiggled as he let off a belch.
sentences.chinese: 当他释怀的时候，他的胃轻摇一打嗝。

sentences.english: LAN know Joan motivation, told the past is misunderstood, Joan eventually let go.
sentences.chinese: 兰知琼动机，告知往事全属误会，琼终释怀。

sentences.english: Shihuai At this moment I do not know how to feel.
sentences.chinese: 吥知茹何释怀此时此刻旳惢情。

sentences.english: B: I don't know. I guess I never really got over it.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道。也许我对这件事从来没有真正释怀吧!

sentences.english: I know I'm not tired, I also know I decadent is she wanted results.
sentences.chinese: 我知道释怀需要时间，我想微寒便是我想要的结果。

sentences.english: You can be assured that I will never darken your door again.
sentences.chinese: 你释怀吧，我今后决不会再登你家的门了。

sentences.english: Again, God is telling us that we need not keep our guilt.
sentences.chinese: 再一次，神告诉我们，不必因罪而难以释怀。

sentences.english: Overseas travellers miss their hometown every day.
sentences.chinese: 海外的游子们无一日能释怀恋乡之情。

sentences.english: I just smile through tears, slightly feeling go.
sentences.chinese: 我才破涕为笑，稍感释怀的。

sentences.english: You may rest assured that the shipment will be duly delivered.
sentences.chinese: 你们尽可释怀，我们会按时交货的。

sentences.english: Literati complex was what that Cao Pi was always cheasing.
sentences.chinese: 文人情结，使曹丕一生难以释怀。

sentences.english: Relieved, I let the book fall behind a stone.
sentences.chinese: 我任由那书本掉落在一块石头后面，很释怀。

definition: to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
to forget
to forget
relieved/at ease/feel relieved
sad/sorrowful
to forget
a matter that gnaws at one's mind/preoccupation/sore point/rancor
pain (from wound)/sorrow
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
sad/emotional/sentimental/pathos
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
distressed/laden with grief
to be forgotten/to fade from memory
not to have room to put sth/to be unable to let go
to give up/to part with
